name: twig/extensions
description: Common additional features for Twig that do not directly belong in core

name: monolog/monolog

suggest.aws/aws-sdk-php: Allow sending log messages to AWS services like DynamoDB
suggest.doctrine/couchdb: Allow sending log messages to a CouchDB server
suggest.ext-amqp: Allow sending log messages to an AMQP server (1.0+ required)
suggest.ext-mongo: Allow sending log messages to a MongoDB server
suggest.graylog2/gelf-php: Allow sending log messages to a GrayLog2 server
suggest.raven/raven: Allow sending log messages to a Sentry server
suggest.rollbar/rollbar: Allow sending log messages to Rollbar
suggest.ruflin/elastica: Allow sending log messages to an Elastic Search server

description: Sends your logs to files, sockets, inboxes, databases and various web services

description: This bundle generates code for you

description: A library for easily creating recursive-descent parsers.

description: Generates documentation for your REST API from annotations

name: willdurand/negotiation
description: Content Negotiation tools for PHP provided as a standalone library.

name: friendsofsymfony/rest-bundle

suggest.jms/serializer-bundle: Add support for advanced serialization capabilities, recommended, requires 0.12.*
suggest.sensio/framework-extra-bundle: Add support for route annotations and the view response listener
suggest.symfony/serializer: Add support for basic serialization capabilities and xml decoding, requires ~2.2
suggest.symfony/validator: Add support for validation capabilities in the ParamFetcher, requires ~2.2

description: This Bundle provides various tools to rapidly develop RESTful API's with Symfony2

suggest.amazonwebservices/aws-sdk-for-php: to use the legacy Amazon S3 adapters

suggest.doctrine/dbal: to use the Doctrine DBAL adapter
suggest.ext-fileinfo: This extension is used to automatically detect the content-type of a file in the AwsS3, OpenCloud, and AzureBlogStorage adapters

description: PHP5 library that provides a filesystem abstraction layer
